Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.model

Class ViewPlayerHand

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.view.model.ViewHand
it.polimi.ingsw.view.model.ViewPlayerHand
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
public class ViewPlayerHand extends ViewHand
The local player's hand. Also contains the player's information such as nickname, color, turn and deadlock status.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewPlayerHand

      public ViewPlayerHand(String nickname, View view)
      Constructs the local player hand
      Parameters:
      nickname - the player's nickname
      view - the View this hand should notify events to.

  • Method Details

    • setCards

      public void setCards(List<ViewPlayCard> cards)
      Description copied from class: ViewHand
      Sets the playCard in hand to the given list of cards.
      Note that the playCard are added by reference to the hand's list, but the list reference itself doesn't change.
      Changes to the list passed as a parameter after this method call will not reflect in the hand. Changes to the playCard will.
      Overrides:
      setCards in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      cards - list of cards to set as the hand content.
      Turns the cards face-down before setting them to the hand.

    • getCard

      public ViewPlayCard getCard(int idx) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns card at given index
      Parameters:
      idx - (0-2) the 0-based card index to return
      Returns:
      the playCard in hand at given index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - the index does not correspond to a card in hand.

    • addCard

      public void addCard(ViewPlayCard card)
      Adds a playCard to the hand.
      Also notifies the addCard event to myArea scene. Turns the card face-up before adding it to hand.
      Overrides:
      addCard in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      card - playCard to add to the hand.

    • removeCard

      public void removeCard(ViewPlayCard card)
      Removes a playCard from the hand.
      Also notifies the removeCard event to myArea scene.
      Overrides:
      removeCard in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      card - playCard to remove from the hand.

    • setSecretObjectiveCards

      public void setSecretObjectiveCards(List<ViewObjectiveCard> objectiveCards)
      Description copied from class: ViewHand
      Sets the objectiveCards in hand to the given list of objectiveCards.
      Note that the objectiveCards are added by reference to the hand's list, but the list reference itself doesn't change.
      Changes to the list passed as a parameter after this method call will not reflect in the hand. Changes to the objectiveCards will.
      Overrides:
      setSecretObjectiveCards in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      objectiveCards - list of objectiveCards to set as the hand content.
      Turns all objective cards face-up before setting them to the hand.

    • addSecretObjectiveCard

      public void addSecretObjectiveCard(ViewObjectiveCard objectiveCard)
      Adds a objectiveCard to the hand.
      Turns the objectiveCard face-up before adding it to hand.
      Also notifies the addObjective event to myArea scene.
      Overrides:
      addSecretObjectiveCard in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      objectiveCard - objectiveCard to add to the hand.

    • chooseObjective

      public void chooseObjective(String choiceID)
      Removes all objectiveCards that do *not* have the given ID.
      Also notifies the chosen objective event to myArea scene.
      Overrides:
      chooseObjective in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      choiceID - the chosen objectiveCard's ID

    • setStartCard

      public void setStartCard(ViewStartCard startCard)
      Sets the start card in this hand.
      Turns the start card face-up before setting it to the hand.
      Also notifies the starting card update event to myArea scene.
      Overrides:
      setStartCard in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      startCard - the starting card, can be null to set a state of "not having a starting card in hand"

    • flipCard

      public void flipCard(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Flips the card in hand at position index (not valid for flipping starting card)
      Parameters:
      index - position of the card to flip (1-3)
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if
      - index < 1
      - index > number of cards in hand

    • flipCard

      public ViewPlaceableCard flipCard(String cardID) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Flips the card in hand identified by cardID (also valid for flipping starting card)
      Parameters:
      cardID - ID of the card to flip (including "starting" to flip the starting card)
      Returns:
      the flipped card
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - there is no card in hand with given cardID

    • setColor

      public boolean setColor(PlayerColor color)
      Sets this player's color.
      Also notifies the color update event to myArea scene. if the color changed with this assignment.
      Overrides:
      setColor in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      color - the new player color (can be null to remove the color)
      Returns:
      true if the color changed with this assignment

    • setTurn

      public boolean setTurn(int turn)
      Sets this player's turn.
      Also notifies the turn update event to myArea scene if the turn changed with this assignment.
      Overrides:
      setTurn in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      turn - the new player turn
      Returns:
      true if the player's turn changed with this assignment

    • setDeadlocked

      public void setDeadlocked(boolean deadlocked)
      Sets the deadlock status for this player.
      Also notifies the deadlock event to myArea scene if the deadlock status was set to true with this assignment.
      Overrides:
      setDeadlocked in class ViewHand
      Parameters:
      deadlocked - new deadlock status
